snippet: The court’s liberals spoke with one voice, and the conservatives with many. The result was one of the most left-leaning terms in recent years.
abstract: Supreme Court term concludes with distinction of being most liberal one since Warren court in late 1960s; outcome illustrates discipline of court's four-member liberal wing and disagreement and disarray among right-wing justices; many analysts say Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg's leadership leveraged votes of her liberal colleagues, while divided conservatives issued separate opinions.
lead_paragraph: The court’s liberals spoke with one voice, and the conservatives with many. The result was one of the most left-leaning terms in recent years.

headline.main: Right Divided, a Disciplined Left Steered the Supreme Court
headline.print_headline: Right Divided, Disciplined Left Steered Justices
